intro: Salacia toussaintii, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and red, fleshy berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. The fruit is edible and has a tart flavor, making it a valuable plant in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
